title_sort: robert buchanan to walt whitman, 28 april 1876
title: Robert Buchanan to Walt Whitman, 28 April 1876
text: 51 Upper Glcster Place Dorset Sq.April 28 thDear Whitman,Enclosed is cheque for £25; statement annexed. You will merely have to endorse it, & the Philadelphia bankers will cash it—kindly acknowledge on receipt.—See my other letter, & address answer Care of Strahan & Co, 34 Paternoster Road.Ever yours Walt Whitman,Robert BuchananI shall wait anxiously for your instructions & statement of affairs.( overall sent in a package by Express Sept 5 '76 Mr Harry Lobb£1-1Richard Bentley Esq.2-2Mr Salaman1Mr Browning2-Mrs Dickens1-1Thomas Ashe1Alfred Tennyson5Townsend Majer1-1School of Art, Newman St, London.18/Wm. Marks1Mr Robinson1Mr Drummond2Messrs Newton, Coleman, & Hisch, 10/each.1-10Hon Roden Noel2-2£22-15 £22-15Cheque enclosed for £25,—Mr Harry Lobb would like a copy of "Two Rivulets," Salaman ditto, Mrs Dickens ditto, Ashe ditto, Majer ditto, Marks ditto, Robinson ditto; Messrs Browning, Drummond, & Noel; the complete works. The others do not want copies, some having them already.—Send the books in a parcel addressed to Robert Buchanan, Care of Strahan & Co, Publishers, 34 Paternoster Row, tender; & I will distribute them.R.B. Robert Buchanan to Walt Whitman, 28 April 1876
